title: Youthful inexperience must no longer be a defence for Manchester United's obvious and reoccurring failings
text:
They are a team that does not look like scoring, with no identifiable style of play, with players who seem to be getting steadily worse led by a manager whose appointment is starting to look like a terrible mistake.

This is not Newcastle United in case you were wondering. They are, despite a difficult and at times, shambolic start to the season, doing alright, all things considered.

The decision to make Steve Bruce the replacement for Rafa Benitez is still not overwhelmingly popular but his second victory lifts Newcastle out of the bottom three and eight points from eight games keeps them on course for survival. Given the timing of his appointment, three weeks before the first competitive game,...
description: They are a team that does not look like scoring, with no identifiable style of play, with players who seem to be getting steadily worse led by a manager whose appointment is starting to look like a terrible mistake.
